item.title: The US is in recession — 76 replies — 202.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
The US is in recession

Open thread • Replies: 76 • Updated: 2026-02-17 04:10 UTC

OP

The US is in recession

Early replies (first 3)

61857499
White collar recession comes before regular recession 100% of the time. We've been in a white collar recession since 2020.

61857500
>>61857490
Always was, its depression for over a year now.

61857508
>>61857490
GDP is growing, recession is fake.

Nothing ever happens.

Stop putting your vibes and feelings into your job search, learn to get better skills and be more marketable to employers.

McDonalds is always hiring

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61859785
>>61858023
Either Mossad agent or photoshopped picture

61859951
>>61857805
>international order
jesus christ turn off the television. US economy (and western economy) is in tatters precisely because of the "international order" ie ZOG. They flood your country with cheap violent labor to suppress wages and sow division, they inflate away your wealth by constantly printing to pay the interest on government borrowing for GIBS for your replacements and zog wars.

How the fuck do you reach the conclusion that America needs an "international order" to function when it's downfall has correlated perfectly to its kowtowing to international interests. America is almost entirely self-sufficient and has plenty of skilled workers. It doesn't need an international order, it needs a financial sector that isn't destroying the country for its own benefit and it needs to get rid of the millions of useless eaters in your country. Get America back up to 70%+ White, fix your money printing problem, deal with the israel problem in your government, and the economy will take care of itself.

It's just nuts to me that people talk about the economy without mentioning the giant rotting elephant in the room which is the trillions that gets siphoned from productive workers to various kike interests. The K-shaped economy isn't an accident it's deliberate.

61859958
>>61857490
>DEI moneysinks getting destroyed
Sucks to suck. Go be a negro in Negrovia or something

61859986
>>61857490
Isn't it good for the US economy if everyone is losing their jobs to AI?

61860143
>>61858383
>go to jobcentre
>get offerd the a streetsweeper
>"I din't waste 6 years of my life getting a master's to sweep puke and shit of the sidewalk"
>"well if you don't want to work than you can't be unemployed, so no benefits for you"
>"Call me Broomy-Mcbroomster guvna"

61860535
>>61860143
I wish I got benefits, I've been unemployed in Poland for 7 years now and I've gotten a grand total of $0 in benefits

61860619
>>61859951
>Get America back up to 70%+ White, fix your money printing problem, deal with the israel problem in your government, and the economy will take care of itself.
anything else while we have the magic wand out sir?

61860705
>>61859951
>How the fuck do you reach the conclusion that America needs an "international order" to function when it's downfall has correlated perfectly to its kowtowing to international interests
What international interests? The US has been profiting off the international order since Breton Woods. Its rise as a superpower correlates to the dollar’s international dominance. It’s the opposite of what you’re describing.
>America is almost entirely self-sufficient
It is completely dependent on foreign pharmaceuticals and various input goods for manufacturing. It has virtually no domestic source of lithium, cobalt, graphite or REMs.
>the problem is international Jewry and this will be rectified when the us becomes an autarky
Why?

The rotting elephant in the room is a declining dollar, obscene debt, and an overinflated market + made up statistics. None of this gets better by fucking up international trade.

61860719
>>61857750

US being in a recession isn't about Trump.
Yes he's a fucking retarded boomer brained moron, but US has been doomed to hit this point sooner or later ever since they decided to crank the money printers on permanently after 2008 and doomed the entire West to be stuck in a slow death limbo.
Everyone has basically just been waiting for the big one for years now and we're getting closer and closer to it.

61860738
>>61859951
You have no idea how the dollar system works and it shows. What's happening to the United States right now is irreversible

61860813
>>61860719
Printing after 2008 happened because 2008 happened, which happened because republicans deregulated finance. You're right, it's not about Trump, it's about half the country being fucking retarded hicks

61860867
>>61860813
Republicans like Raegan deregulated finance, that’s true (though some of that was put into motion by Jimmy Carter). That said, it’s impossible to talk about 2008 without recognizing that Clinton is the one who repealed the Glass-Steagall act and let insurance banking merge with commercial banking. Pretty much every president for the 30 years leading up to 2008 did something to enable it or make it worse.

61860880
>>61860867
I forgot that Clinton was also the one that made derivatives immune to regulation. He really fucked up finance.

61860916
>>61857825
Holy shit this is the most retarded post I have ever read on /biz/, why are you on a finance board??

61860980
>>61860880
Clinton also forced banks to give mortgages to people with bad credit scores and low income

61861063
>>61857508

GDP was never meant to measure the health of the economy. Simon Kuznets advised against using it for that purpose.

61861445
>>61860705
>It has virtually no domestic source of lithium, cobalt, graphite or REMs.
There are actually fucking tons of sources, but none of them are developed because US companies exported the environmental cost of mining them to "dEvElOpInG" nations for cheaper labor/materials and most of the mines shut down because they couldn't compete. There are ludicrous amounts of these materials just sitting there in the US.

The US could be self-sufficient (example: fracking boom was because oil price had gotten to the point where domestic supply was economically viable again - in less than a decade the US had more oil than it could even use, because the oil was already in the ground, just not being extracted), but the profit motive won't allow self-sufficiency to persist if it's cheaper to import.

61861531
>>61861445
>”we are almost entirely self-sufficient”
>”ok we currently have no infrastructure to mine these resources”
Yes, exactly. We are totally dependent on foreign suppliers and as of right now we do not have a domestic source for these things. My point stands and yours is wrong. Coping about how we COULD have these things eventually doesn’t matter. Like it or not, the US is not self-sufficient, and it isn’t close. We import tremendous amounts of goods. Don’t even bother looking into pharmaceuticals because it will just depress you.

61861694
>>61857750
We've been in a recession since 2023. This isn't glorphf's fault or joepedo. Our economy is fake and gay made up of jewish daycare bullshit jobs. Soon it will all unravel.

61861711
>>61861531
Don't get your panties in a bunch, all I took issue with was saying "virtually no domestic source." Some people in these discussions act like SEA is the only place in the world that has minerals.

A water source is still there even if nobody builds a well. Since you seem to get that, you were probably looking for the phrase "domestic SUPPLY."

61861724
>>61857805

Oh no, its over, the Europeans and Anglos are mad we voted a republican again.

61861729
>>61858084
The fantasy is better than the reality

61861769
>>61857805
We should be bombing Mexico.

61861811
>>61861711
No I wasn’t. I don’t feel like explaining it to you so I’ll just let AI do it.

61863135
>>61858023

61863175
>>61857490
BUMP

61863206

Nobody wants that shit yet it is going up with not only no buyers but countries constantly throwing it into the market. Absolute shitshow from a drowning in shit man.
Funny isn't it?

61863218
>>61860719
The boat that is jewsa has been sinking for a while. The orange nigger is actively making more holes in it and setting it on fire

61863252

61863679

item.title: What the fuck is the deal with PTO — 18 replies — 23.5/hr
item.content:encoded:
What the fuck is the deal with PTO

Open thread • Replies: 18 • Updated: 2026-02-17 03:46 UTC

OP

So I've only worked one white collar job my whole life, and we would always just book our vacations in advance, we were given 5 weeks of vacation every year and we would just tell them what days we want off.
Now I'm going into this new corporate job and they're saying I have to earn my vacations? And earn my holidays? Wtf is this shit. How giving fast do I earn these good boy vacation days. THIS IS FUCKING RETARDED

Early replies (first 3)

61860924
>>61860903
they expect you to work like a jeet, congratulations thanks for playing

61860942
>>61860903
5 weeks of vacation is 200 hours. you earn 16.67 hours a month. some places let you take vacation as you want and only make a big deal if you quit or run deep into the negatives. other, shittier places make no exceptions.

61860971
>>61860903
>be me
>want to take vacation
>no accrual (though technically I could probably owe them money if I took 4 weeks in January and then quit)
>put it on my calendar
>don't check with nobody
>not even logged with the timesheet accounting
>day comes
>set email responder
This is why I'm hesitant to look for a new job.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61860987
>>61860924
Basically this
Corporate got filled with low trust taskmasters in the wake of flooding every major urban area with low trust resource sinks
The only solution at this point is a parallel economy that turns into a (non official because oy vey) parallel state apparatus.
We have the resources to do this now, but no coherent culture to nucleate around

61860994
>wah my boss won't pay for me to not work

61861001
>>61860987
So you're saying that the quality of the employee went down, that's the quality of their supervisors went down, thus trust was lost in the old fashioned system like I had in my first job is the way the dinosaur now and it's probably is very rare to have a job where you can just get a set amount of vacation per year without earning it?

61861025
>>61860903
I worked at a tech company with unlimited PTO, and barely anyone actually took time off. I always felt weird taking sick days or whatever because all of my coworkers were workaholics.

61861031
>>61861025
"unlimited PTO" means you just get fired without warning if you take time off

61861033
>>61861001
Yes, that's basically it
Blame every single policymaker and adherent to "multiculturalism." Many cultures on the planet are in no way bad, even sampled within one area, but there are ZERO instances of long term multiculturalism without major strife, war, and civilizational/societal degradation. Homogeneous cultures, planted at the root of the psyche, are the one guaranteed pathway to the success of the human macroorganism

61861082
>>61860903
The thing that pisses me off about PTO is that I'm unable to take UPTO. Sure, give me a certain amount of paid days off but if I want to take unpaid days off I should be able to have as many as I want. Fuck you.

61861089
>>61861082
That too. I might not have made a profit while self employed, but these white collar mind games suck

61861115
>>61861082
That would mean your job is so expendable that they can allow you to just leave and come back as you please without having any significant impact on business operations. In which case they might as well just replace you.

61861197
Thinly veiled data-mining thread

Thinly vailed ragebait thread

OP is/will always be a cuck

61861198
>>61860903
If you signed, it's your fault anon. Next time be ready to do a 360 on the spot if you don't like the contract

61861502
>>61861115
Kind of, but also not really...I work in admin in the life insurance & personal finance industry, if I've shown myself to be dependable come crunch time, am able to develop processes to make sure cases are compliant, basically keep shit in order, it's way more expensive to attempt to hire new and retrain (not to mention re-certify new hires if they come in unlicensed) and re-vet potential new hires. Just because I do all this doesn't mean I shouldn't be able to take as much time off as I want when it's a slow period, or I'm able to find someone else to cover while I'm away, you know?

61861533
>>61860903
Yeah I had to work for 2 years with no days off to earn enough PTO to take two weeks off at one job. If you called in they took a PTO day away and gave you a point. 7 points and it was automatic termination.

61861543
earn means time in this case
this is so you can't take you 5 weeks on day one and then quit after that

61863592
>>61861502
No, exactly really. If you're completely optional, then you're completely unneeded.

item.title: My fellow Link Marines, we all know that JPM is behind Link's ICO, and even Ethereum. — 8 replies — 14.8/hr
item.content:encoded:
My fellow Link Marines, we all know that JPM is behind Link's ICO, and even Ethereum.

Open thread • Replies: 8 • Updated: 2026-02-17 04:00 UTC

OP

My fellow Link Marines, we all know that JPM is behind Link's ICO, and even Ethereum. Investigate the relationship between ConsenSys, Lubin, ETH, and JPM.

Vitalik is just a puppet; it's all part of a hidden strategy, Lubin is the man setting up everything form the beginning

In the future, JPM might employ tactics like mergers and acquisitions (M&A), forcing the ChainLink team to step down or giving their control, orchestrating bankruptcy, or potentially setting up Liink from the beginning. Their goal?

To build JPM's private blockchain, Liink Onyx; Liink Onyx double ii, not your missing piece of God protocol Link,

Crypto Oracle and ChainlinkGod are paid by Chainlink team for their brainwash content.

Sergey Nazarov or Ari Jules play their roles in the beast system, making it seem like they control everything.

But with cunning entity like JPM, early investors may have a hard time finding exit opportunities during mergers or acquisitions. JPM could declare bankruptcy for Link before consolidating control, putting an end to Link trading activities. Those who hold until the end may have limited options; it's ultimately a game of probability.

This situation is quite daunting. Swift seems to be building a private blockchain using JPM's Liink and integrating Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) into traditional financial markets.

Chainlink may just remain a dream of wealth, an American dream, because you have to dream to even see it....

I am completely buckbroken, I’m selling my 4400 Stinkies for a 20k realized loss. I was expecting it to be my ticket to being able to exit the system and farm and provide clean food for my family and community.

Maybe my silver stack will end up being something more than a down payment. Hope all my fellow anons are hanging in there in these dark times. Remember, They want you to fear. Don’t give them that power

item.title: GET MONERO (XMR) - The Time is NOW — 12 replies — 6.8/hr
item.content:encoded:
GET MONERO (XMR) - The Time is NOW

Open thread • Replies: 12 • Updated: 2026-02-17 02:46 UTC

OP

>unrealized capital gains taxes
>stablecoins everywhere (CBDCs by another name)
>surveillance everywhere
>AI completely opens up all non-private chains

There is ONLY ONE coin that will be used in the future. It's time to leave the surveilled world. Preserve your privacy and use Monero.

Early replies (first 3)

61859034
>>61859030
buy an ad.

61859041
>>61859034
buy a clue

61859283
>>61859030

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61859940
>XMR plummets
honestly I realised the other day, that the scenario in which one becomes truly valuable is the same scenario in which society becomes so unstable that you probably wouldn't survive trying to trade it

61860246
>>61859940
>Still wants to trade in the desolate future

61860352
>>61859034
retard

61860645
>>61859940
Like it or not this is the future in front of you. Massive AI layoffs, causing incredible levels of unemployment. The need for “UBI” (CBDC tracking all transactions and censoring ones “they” don’t like). Hopelessness for the future of work. People wondering what the point of their pathetic lives are.

At least Monero can give you a semblance of sovereignty. And it will be in extremely high demand as the only untraceable form of digital money. So you’ll get rich too, whatever that means in 2030+.

61861254
>>61859940
More like society becomes so unstable you'll only survive by trading outside the UBI ration system. Monero isn't for making money, it is money.

61861451
>>61861254
>being one of the first million or so people to acquire a substantial amount of the future world money isn't something that will increase your relative purchasing power
>monero defies the laws of supply and demand
ok.

Only I know about it and no one can take it from me ever.
